get.description: To search for all calls sent or received by the user. Use "id=0" for the campaignId parameter to query for all calls sent through the POST /calls API. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: To set the maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0. Check [pagination](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#pagination) page for more information about pagination in CallFire API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lists the Call ids to search for. If calls ids are specified then other query parameters can be ignored

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: An id of a campaign, queries for calls included to a particular campaign. Specify null for all campaigns and 0 for default campaign

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: An id of a contact batch, queries for calls of a particular contact batch

parameters.name: fromNumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was from. Example: 12132000384

parameters.name: toNumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was sent to. Example: 12132000384

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A label for a specific call

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Searches for all calls which correspond to statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, FINISHED, DISABLED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: Searches for all calls with statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: inbound
parameters.description: Filters inbound calls for "true" value and outbound calls for "false" value

parameters.name: intervalBegin
parameters.description: Start of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

parameters.name: intervalEnd
parameters.description: End of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

post.description: Use the /calls API to send individual calls quickly. A verified Caller ID and sufficient credits are required to make a call. CallRecipient represents a single recipient identified by phone number or contact id in CallFire system. You can attach user-defined attributes to a Call action via CallRecipient.attributes property, attributes are available in Call action response

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: An id of a campaign, queries for calls included to a particular campaign. Specify null for all campaigns and 0 for default campaign

parameters.name: defaultLiveMessage
parameters.description: Text to be turned into a sound, this text will be played when the phone is answered. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

parameters.name: defaultMachineMessage
parameters.description: Text to be turned into a sound, this text will be played when answering machine is detected. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

parameters.name: defaultLiveMessageSoundId
parameters.description: Id of sound file to play if phone is answered. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

parameters.name: defaultMachineMessageSoundId
parameters.description: An id of a sound file to play if answering machine is detected. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

parameters.name: defaultVoice
parameters.description: The voice set by default for all text-to-speech messages defined in CallRecipient objects or as default *Message properties

parameters.name: strictValidation
parameters.description: Turns on strict validation for recipients. System will reply with BAD_REQUEST(400) if strictValidation = true and one of numbers didn't pass validation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

get.description: Searches for all voice broadcasts created by user. Can query on label, name, and the current running status of the campaign. Returns a paged list of voice broadcasts

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: To set the maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0. Check [pagination](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#pagination) page for more information about pagination in CallFire API.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A label for a specific call

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A name of voice broadcast

parameters.name: running
parameters.description: Specify whether the campaigns should be running or not

post.description: Creates a call broadcast campaign using the Call Broadcast API. Send a CallBroadcast in the message body to add details in a voice broadcast campaign. The campaign can be created without contacts and bare minimum configuration, but contacts will have to be added further on to use the campaign

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Specify whether to immediately start this campaign (not required)

parameters.name: strictValidation
parameters.description: Turns on strict validation for recipients. System will reply with BAD_REQUEST(400) if strictValidation = true and one of numbers didn't pass validation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

get.description: Returns a single CallBroadcast instance for a given call broadcast campaign id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id of a CallBroadcast

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

put.description: This operation lets the user modify the configuration of a voice broadcast campaign after call broadcast campaign is created. See CallBroadcast for more information on what can/can't be updated on this API

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id of a CallBroadcast

parameters.name: strictValidation
parameters.description: Turns on strict validation for recipients. System will reply with BAD_REQUEST(400) if strictValidation = true and one of numbers didn't pass validation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id of a CallBroadcast

get.summary: Find batches in a call broadcast
get.description: This endpoint will enable the user to page through all of the batches for a particular voice broadcast campaign

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

parameters.name: offset

post.summary: Add batches to a call broadcast
post.description: The 'add batch' API allows user to add additional batches to an already created voice broadcast campaign. The added batch will go through the CallFire validation process, unlike in the recipients version of this API. That is why you can use the scrubDuplicates flag to remove duplicates from your batch. Batches may be added as a contact list id, a list of contact ids, or a list of numbers

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id of a CallBroadcast

parameters.name: strictValidation
parameters.description: Turns on strict validation for recipients. System will reply with BAD_REQUEST(400) if strictValidation = true and one of numbers didn't pass validation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

post.summary: Add recipients to a call broadcast
post.description: Use this API to add the recipients to an existing voice broadcast. Post a list of Recipient objects to be added to the voice broadcast campaign. These contacts will not go through validation process, and will be acted upon as they are added. Recipients may be added as a list of contact ids, or list of numbers

An array of CallRecipient objects.

An array of CallRecipient objects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lists the Call ids to search for. If calls ids are specified then other query parameters can be ignored

post.description: Creates a contact list for use with campaigns using 1 of 3 inputs. A List of Contact objects, a list of String E.164 numbers, or a list of CallFire contactIds can be used as the data source for the created contact list. After contact list is added into the CallFire system, contact lists goes through seven system safeguards that check the accuracy and consistency of the data. For example, our system checks that contact number is formatted correctly, is valid, is not duplicated in another contact

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

get.description: Find credit usage for the user. Returns credits usage for time period specified or if unspecified then total for all time.

parameters.name: intervalEnd

get.description: Searches for the data of a billing plan usage for the user. Returns the data of a billing plan usage for the current month
Returns a list of verified caller ids. If the number is not shown in the list, then it is not verified. In this case sending of a verification code is required.

post.description: Generates and sends a verification code to the phone number provided in the path. The verification code is delivered via a phone call. This code needs to be submitted to the verify caller id API endpoint to complete verification.

parameters.name: callerid
parameters.description: A phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) which needs to be verified. Example: 12132000384

post.description: With the verification code received from the Create caller id endpoint, a call to this endpoint is required to finish verification

parameters.name: callerid
parameters.description: A phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) which needs to be verified. Example: 12132000384

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

get.description: Searches for all numbers leased by account user. This API is useful for finding all numbers currently owned by the user. Returns a paged list of number leases.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

post.description: Purchase numbers. There are many ways to purchase a number. Set either 'tollFreeCount' or 'localCount' along with some querying fields to purchase numbers by bulk query. Set the list of numbers to purchase by list. Available numbers will be purchased using CallFire credits owned by the user. Make sure the account has enough credits before trying to purchase

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

get.description: Returns a single NumberOrder instance for a given order id. Order contains information about purchased keywords, local, toll-free numbers

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

get.description: Searches for texts sent or received by user. Use "campaignId=0" parameter to query for all texts sent through the POST /texts API. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: To set the maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0. Check [pagination](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#pagination) page for more information about pagination in CallFire API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Lists the Call ids to search for. If calls ids are specified then other query parameters can be ignored

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: An id of a campaign, queries for calls included to a particular campaign. Specify null for all campaigns and 0 for default campaign

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: An id of a contact batch, queries for calls of a particular contact batch

parameters.name: fromNumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was from. Example: 12132000384

parameters.name: toNumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was sent to. Example: 12132000384

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A label for a specific call

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Searches for all calls which correspond to statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, FINISHED, DISABLED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: Searches for all calls with statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

parameters.name: inbound
parameters.description: Filters inbound calls for "true" value and outbound calls for "false" value

parameters.name: intervalBegin
parameters.description: Start of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

parameters.name: intervalEnd
parameters.description: End of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

post.description: Use the /texts API to send individual texts quickly. By default all texts are going out from CallFire's dedicated short code 67076

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: An id of a campaign, queries for calls included to a particular campaign. Specify null for all campaigns and 0 for default campaign

parameters.name: defaultMessage
parameters.description: Text message can be overridden by TextRecipient.message field. If multiple recipients have the same text message to a different recipients it is better to specify a single default message and do not duplicate it in each recipient.

parameters.name: strictValidation
parameters.description: Turns on strict validation for recipients. System will reply with BAD_REQUEST(400) if strictValidation = true and one of numbers didn't pass validation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Multiple contact numbers can be specified. If the number parameter is included, the other query parameters are ignored.

post.description: CallFire gives you possibility to set up auto reply messages for your numbers and keywords. You can set a general auto reply for anyone who texts your number, keyword, and/or include a text to match, so that the auto reply would be sent only to those who text the matched text

parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects.

post.description: Creates a text broadcast campaign using the Text Broadcast API. Send a TextBroadcast object in the message body to detail a text broadcast campaign. A campaign can be created without contacts and with bare minimum configuration, but contacts have to be added further on to use the campaign. It supports scheduling, retry logic, pattern-based messages.

parameters.description: Specify whether to immediately start this campaign (not required)

parameters.name: strictValidation

post.summary: Add batches to a text broadcast
post.description: Allows adding an extra batches to an already created text broadcast campaign. The batches which being  added pass the CallFire validation process (unlike in the recipients version of this API). That is why using of a scrubDuplicates flag remove duplicates from your batch. Batches may be added as a contact list id, a list of contact ids, or a list of numbers

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An id of a CallBroadcast

parameters.name: strictValidation
parameters.description: Turns on strict validation for recipients. System will reply with BAD_REQUEST(400) if strictValidation = true and one of numbers didn't pass validation

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

post.summary: Add recipients to a text broadcast
post.description: Use this API to add recipients to a text broadcast which is already created. Post a list of Recipient objects to be immediately added to the text broadcast campaign. These contacts will not go through validation process, and will be acted upon as they are added. Recipients may be added as a list of contact ids, or list of numbers

parameters.description: A name of voice broadcast

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: A name of a resource, available values: 'CccCampaign', 'CallBroadcast', 'TextBroadcast',  'OutboundCall', 'OutboundText', 'InboundCall', 'InboundText', 'ContactList'

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: A name of event, available values: 'started', 'stopped', 'finished'

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback URL

parameters.description: Specifies whether webhook is enabled

post.description: Create a Webhook for notification in the CallFire system. Use the webhooks API to receive notifications of important CallFire events. Select the resource to listen to, and then choose the resource events to receive notifications on. When an event triggers, a POST will be made to the callback URL with a payload of notification information. Available resources and their events include 'CccCampaign': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'CallBroadcast': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'TextBroad

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
An array of CallRecipient objects. 
Limitations:
1. Max number of CallRecipient objects is 10

get.description: Searches for webhook resources.
